definition: War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to fight/fight/war/battle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: By late liberation war, the conditions for multi-party cooperation toward maturity.
sentences.chinese: 到了解放戰爭後期，多黨合作的條件趨於成熟。

sentences.english: During the War of Liberation the policy of land reform was carried out in some newly-liberated areas.
sentences.chinese: 在解放戰爭時期，一些新解放區內實行了土改政策。

sentences.english: Most of them came into the world during the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他們大多數人是解放戰爭期間出世的。
解放戰爭時期，膠東半島。

sentences.english: This is a heroic company which fought on many fronts in the Liberation War.
sentences.chinese: 這是一支解放戰爭中經過南征北戰的英雄連隊。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役對解放戰爭的勝利至關重要。

sentences.english: It started to fall. In the liberation war, and was cracked down after New China was founded.
sentences.chinese: 解放戰爭時期哥老會走向沒落，新中國成立後被摧毀。

sentences.english: The victory of National Liberation War entirely realized Chinese national independence, and it incarnates the orderliness of historical period of China.
sentences.chinese: 解放戰爭的勝利是中國歷史大週期律的體現。

sentences.english: The Liberation War broke out in autumn , 1946.
sentences.chinese: 一九四六年秋，解放戰爭已打響。

sentences.english: The tune was composed at the beginning of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 這支曲子是在解放戰爭初期譜寫的。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of    Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役對解放戰爭的勝利至關重要。

sentences.english: Both museums descend from the same institution, but were split after the Chinese Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 兩院原屬一院，於解放戰爭後分爲兩館。

sentences.english: Drifting, how many people died in The liberation war?
sentences.chinese: 沙僧，解放戰爭死了多少人啊？

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Korean War (1950-1953)

Korean War (1950-1953)

to resist the enemy
student movement
army grouping/collective army
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
guerrilla warfare
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
army and government
